page.title: 19Transport - Public Services
page.content: Despite many recent cutbacks the village of Whalley remains a busy bus route-some{13 services}stopping at the village bus station. Hourly or half-hourly services operate between the local towns of{ {Burnley, Accrington, Blackburn}and {Clitheroe}as well as{Manchester. { }A more irregular service operates between the smaller villages of{Hurst {Green, Ribchester}and{Wiswell.} Until the early 70's the village of Whalley had always been a serious bottleneck on the{A59}(Liverpool/York) The building of the Whalley{bypass alleviated this problem and all non- village traffic now runs smoothly to the west of the village. Parallel to the bypass runs Whalley {Railway Viaduct}which now only carries goods trains between Blackburn and Hellifield.
